This page includes links to related projects that use immigration enforcement data collected by us and others to provide analysis, visualizations, and reports for attorneys, advocates, government, and the public.

## Data analysis and visualization

<div style="float: right; padding-left: 15px"><img src="img/vera-screenshot.png" alt="Preview of Vera Detention Trends Dashboard" width=250><br><figcaption>Source: Vera Institute</figcaption></div>

[Transaction Records Clearinghouse: Immigration](https://tracreports.org/immigration)
: Immigration courts, detention, and deportation data.

[Immigration Enforcement Dashboard](https://enforcementdashboard.com)
: Tabular and visual summaries of patterns in ICE arrests.

[Detention Facilities Statistics](https://detentionreports.com/)
: Statistics on ICE detention facilities including average daily population, capacity, and demographics. 

[University of Washington Center for Human Rights](https://jsis.washington.edu/humanrights/)
: Detention and deportation data including on ICE deporation flights ("ICE Air").

[Vera Institute](https://www.vera.org)
: Immigration courts, detention, and deportation data.

  - [Immigration Court Legal Representation Dashboard](https://www.vera.org/ending-mass-incarceration/reducing-incarceration/detention-of-immigrants/advancing-universal-representation-initiative/immigration-data-tools-and-maps)
  - [ICE Detention Trends Dashboard](https://www.vera.org/ice-detention-trends)

[ILRC 287(g) Map](https://www.ilrc.org/practitioners/national-map-287g-agreements)
: Map of 287(g) agreements from the Immigrant Legal Resource Center.

## Data collection

[American Immigration Council Transparency Initiative](https://www.americanimmigrationcouncil.org/what-we-do/government-transparency)
: Uses the Freedom of Information Act to secure data and documentation from government agencies and take them to court when they fail to comply. 

[ICE Flight Monitor](https://humanrightsfirst.org/ice-flight-monitor/)
: Identifies deportation flights by ICE contractors ("ICE Air").

[Tracking 287(g) agreements](https://github.com/appelson/Tracking-287g)
: Obtains agreements between ICE and local law enforcement agencies that allow those agencies to enforce immigration laws via daily web scraping.

## Immigration policy

<div style="float: right; padding-left: 15px"><img src="img/policy-tracker-screenshot.png" alt="Preview of Immigration Policy Tracker" width=250><br><figcaption>Source: Immigration Policy Tracker</figcaption></div>

[Immigration Policy Tracker](https://immpolicytracking.org)  
: Compiles and indexes all identifiable Trump 1.0 and 2.0 immigration policies with key source documents and continually updates each entry to show its current status.
